THIS AWARD TO THE COUNTY OF NASSAU AIMS TO REDUCE THE AVERAGE NUMBER OF LARGE TRUCK AND BUS ACCIDENTS  CONDUCT ENFORCEMENT TO ENHANCE CMV WORK ZONE SAFETY  IMPROVE THE IDENTIFICATION OF OPERATORS WITH DRUG AND ALCOHOL VIOLATIONS THAT PROHIBIT THEM FROM LAWFULLY DRIVING A COMMERCIAL MOTOR VEHICLE  REDUCE THE AVERAGE NUMBER OF ANNUAL PEDESTRIAN, BICYCLIST, AND MOTORCYCLIST DEATHS  THE FIRST STEP IN INCREASING THE NUMBER OF INSPECTIONS AND ENFORCEMENT STOPS CONDUCTED WILL BE TO PLAN THE DATES, TIMES, AND LOCATIONS WHERE THESE INSPECTIONS WILL BE MOST EFFECTIVE  SUPERVISORS WILL BE TASKED WITH REVIEWING A MULTITUDE OF DATA, INCLUDING HISTORICAL DATA AND STATISTICS, AS WELL AS RECENT TRENDS, TO IDENTIFY THE BEST LOCATIONS TO DEPLOY TARGETED ENFORCEMENT

THIS AWARD TO THE CITY OF AUSTIN AIMS TO DECREASE FATAL COLLISIONS AND SERIOUS MINOR INJURY CRASHES, DECREASE FATALITIES AND COLLISIONS INVOLVING DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN COMMERCIAL MOTOR VEHICLES, REDUCE THE NUMBER OF HOURS OF SERVICE VIOLATIONS FOUND IN ROADSIDE INSPECTIONS AND DURING CARRIER INVESTIGATIONS, AND DECREASE DOMESTIC AND FOREIGN CARRIER SAFETY INSPECTION VIOLATIONS  FUNDING WILL ALLOW PROJECT STAFF TO IMPLEMENT HIGHLY VISIBLE TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT AND COMMERCIAL VEHICLE SAFETY INSPECTION PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT A FIVE CORRIDOR AREA TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF TRUCK RELATED FATALITIES, AND TO CHANGE UNSAFE AND AGGRESSIVE DRIVING PRACTICES

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD TO THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND IS FOR RESEARCH TO INCREASE THE RATE OF CMV ENFORCEMENT CITATIONS PER ENFORCEMENT BLITZ, REDUCE THE RESOURCES NEEDED TO IDENTIFY LOCATIONS FOR ENFORCEMENT BLITZES, AND REDUCE THE RESOURCES TO EVALUATE ENFORCEMENT EFFECTIVENESS  THE OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE A NEW ONLINE TOOL THAT AUTOMATES THE DATA FUSION PROCESS AND STREAMLINES THE CMV ENFORCEMENT PLANNING, EXECUTION, EVALUATION, AND RESULT SHARING PROCESS

THIS AWARD TO THE LOUISIANA STATE UNIVERSITY  LSU  IS FOR RESEARCH TO EXAMINE UNSAFE DRIVING AND DRIVER RESPONSES BEFORE CMV CRASHES OCCUR AND TO IDENTIFY SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS TO REDUCE CMV AND NON CMV CRASHES  LSU PROPOSES TO IMPROVE CMV SAFETY BY COLLABORATING WITH MOTOR CARRIER COMPANIES IN LOUISIANA AND USING VIDEO CAMERAS INSTALLED TO VIEW THE SIDE AND REAR OF THE TRUCK  ADVANCED VIDEO ANALYTICS WILL BE DONE WITH DATA CAPTURED FROM CAMERAS MOUNTED ON THE TRUCKS  THE INFORMATION WILL BE ANALYZED TO IDENTIFY CMV, AND PASSENGER VEHICLE CONFLICT SITUATIONS CAUSED BY UNSAFE DRIVER BEHAVIOR

THIS AWARD TO THE KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY IS TO BRING TOGETHER CMV SAFETY GROUPS IN THE MIDWEST INCLUDING THE KANSAS HIGHWAY PATROL FOR THE PROPOSED SECOND COMMERCIAL VEHICLE SAFETY SUMMIT TO BE HELD IN EITHER KANSAS CITY, MISSOURI OR KANSAS CITY, KANSAS IN THE SUMMER OF 2024  THE SECOND COMMERCIAL VEHICLE SAFETY SUMMIT WILL BE EITHER A ONE AND A HALF DAY OR TWO DAY EVENT FOCUSED ON BRINGING TOGETHER A LARGE GROUP OF STAKEHOLDERS INTERESTED IN REDUCING THE NUMBER AND SEVERITY OF CRASHES IN THE MIDWEST  THE PROPOSED CONFERENCE THEME IS   REDUCING THE NUMBER AND SEVERITY OF CRASHES ON RURAL HIGHWAYS AND INTERSTATES IN THE MIDWEST

THIS AWARD TO THE COUNTY OF SUFFOLK AIMS TO FOCUS ENFORCEMENT ON BOTH CMV S  LARGE TRUCKS AND PASSENGER CARRYING VEHICLES  AND NON CMV VEHICLES, TARGETING AGGRESSIVE AND DISTRACTED DRIVING VIOLATIONS, INCLUDING SPEEDING, TAILGATING, HANDS ON CELL PHONE USAGE, TEXTING, AND INFRACTIONS OF NEW YORK STATE S  MOVE OVER  LAW, WHICH REQUIRES MOTORISTS TO SLOW DOWN AND OR CHANGE LANES FOR STOPPED EMERGENCY AND HAZARD VEHICLES  SPEEDING AND DISTRACTED DRIVING BOTH CONTINUE TO BE AMONG THE LEADING CAUSES OF CRASHES THAT RESULT IN INJURIES AND FATALITIES

THIS AWARD TO THE TEXAS AAND M TRANSPORTATION INSTITUTE IS FOR RESEARCH TO IMPROVE CMV SAFETY IN WORK ZONES  THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES INCLUDE  1  IDENTIFYING AND DESCRIBING FACTORS CONTRIBUTING TO CRASHES IN WORK ZONES, 2  DEVELOPING WORK ZONE CRASH PROFILES BY RURAL, URBAN, AND FRINGE LOCATIONS FOR TEXAS, 3  IDENTIFYING ENFORCEMENT CHALLENGES IN WORK ZONES BY INTERVIEWING LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS ABOUT DRIVER BEHAVIORS AND COMMON WORK ZONE SET UPS, 4  DEVELOPING AN EXPERIENTIAL, EVIDENCE BASED WORK ZONE TRAINING MODULE FOR TRUCK TRACTOR DRIVERS, 5  EVALUATING THE IMPACT OF THE EXPERIENTIAL TRAINING MODULE ON TRUCK TRACTOR DRIVER PERFORMANCE, RISK PERCEPTION AND HOW RISK PERCEPTION IS RELATED TO DRIVING EXPERIENCE AND PERFORMANCE, 6  CONDUCTING A THREE MONTH FOLLOW UP PILOT ASSESSMENT OF THE IMPACT OF THE TRAINING MODULE ON RISK PERCEPTION AND DRIVING PERFORMANCE OF AT LEAST 10 DRIVERS IN THE TREATMENT GROUP, 7  DEVELOPING AND DISTRIBUTING OUTREACH AND EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS TO LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS, AND 8  IDENTIFYING ENGINEERING ISSUES FOR WORK ZONE SETUP IN TEXAS

THIS AWARD TO THE MARSHALL UNIVERSITY RESEARCH CORPORATION IS FOR RESEARCH TO ENABLE MORE EFFECTIVE ENFORCEMENT AND ENGINEERING EFFORTS TO HELP REDUCE THE NUMBER AND SEVERITY OF CMV CRASHES IN WEST VIRGINIA  THE FOLLOWING ARE THE OBJECTIVES  1  GENERATE AT LEAST 10 CMV CRASH DEFINITIONS IMPORTANT TO WEST VIRGINIA STAKEHOLDERS  2  GENERATE A PROTOTYPE CMV CRASH DASHBOARD THAT ALLOWS INTERACTION WITH THE CRASH DATA DEFINED BY THE PREVIOUS OBJECTIVE  3  BUILD A CRASH LOCATOR TOOL CAPABLE OF DISPLAYING THE LOCATION OF CRASHES ON A MAP  4  REVIEW 100  OF THE CMV RELATED CRASH RECORDS IN WV FOR THE MOST RECENT 5 YEARS AND EVALUATE THE LOCATION ACCURACY  5  GENERATE A LATITUDE LONGITUDE, ROUTE ID AND MILEPOINT CONSISTENT WITH THE WVDOT LINEAR REFERENCE SYSTEM FOR 100  OF THE CMV CRASH RECORDS THAT CONTAIN LOCATION INFORMATION  6  GENERATE A HOT SPOT ANALYSIS MAP FOR AT LEAST ONE TYPE OF CMV CRASH DEFINED IN OBJECTIVE 1

THIS AWARD TO THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AIMS TO INCREASE PRESENCE IN RURAL AREAS, INCREASE ENFORCEMENT DETAILS, INCREASE THE NUMBER OF CONTACTS WITH COMMERCIAL MOTOR VEHICLES, AND REDUCE THE NUMBER OF CRASHES, INJURIES, AND FATALITIES  THE DESIGNATED LOCATIONS WILL BE ON BASED ON CRASH FATALITY RATES, VOLUME OF COMMERCIAL VEHICLE TRAFFIC, ROADWAY CONDITIONS, AND ROADWAYS WITH TRAVEL RESTRICTIONS FOR COMMERCIAL VEHICLES  CMV INSPECTORS WILL FOCUS ON THE PHYSICAL STATE OF THE DRIVERS, DRIVER QUALIFICATIONS, DRIVER PROHIBITIONS, HOURS OF SERVICE REGULATIONS, VEHICLE S SIZE AND WEIGHT, AND OTHER VEHICLE VIOLATIONS

THIS AWARD TO THE HOWARD UNIVERSITY  HBCU  IS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT A NATIONAL HBCU SUMMIT FOR FMCSA OPPORTUNITIES WHERE  1  HBCUS WILL LEARN ABOUT THE FEDERAL MOTOR CARRIER SAFETY ADMINISTRATION  FMCSA , ITS MISSION, AVAILABLE FUNDING OPPORTUNITIES, AND HOW TO LEVERAGE THEIR COMPETENCIES TO BECOME A GRANTEE  2  HBCU S REPRESENTATIVES WILL PARTICIPATE IN WORKSHOPS, DETAILING THE GRANT APPLICATION PROCESS, IN ADDITION TO PRESENTING FURTHER OPPORTUNITIES OF POTENTIAL PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHER EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS AND LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES  3  HUTRC WILL SHARE ITS EXPERIENCE AS AN FMCSA GRANTEE AND BEST PRACTICES IN PROVIDING SUPPORT TO ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES REGARDING GRANT APPLICATION, GRANT MANAGEMENT AND CRASH DATA ANALYSIS

THIS AWARD TO THE MORGAN STATE UNIVERSITY IS FOR RESEARCH RELATED TO DECREASING DRIVERS  ERRATIC BEHAVIOR CAUSED BY OR ROOTED IN AGGRESSIVE DRIVING, DISTRACTED DRIVING, AND FATIGUE  THE RESEARCH TEAM WILL USE A FULL SCALE HIGH FIDELITY DRIVING SIMULATOR THAT IS IN THE SAFETY AND BEHAVIORAL ANALYSIS CENTER AT MORGAN STATE UNIVERSITY  THE DRIVING SIMULATOR IS CAPABLE OF REPLICATING DRIVING TASKS ON DIFFERENT ROADWAYS AND PAVEMENT TYPES, UNDER VARIOUS TRAFFIC CONDITIONS AND COMPOSITION, AND WEATHER CONDITIONS  DATA SUCH AS LANE CHANGING, ACCELERATION, BRAKING, STEERING CONTROL, SPEED, AND CRASHES ARE RECORDED IN REAL TIME BY THE DRIVING SIMULATOR SOFTWARE

THIS AWARD TO THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF EMERGENCY SERVICES IS TO  1  CONDUCT ENFORCEMENT AND INSPECTIONS ON ALL COMMERCIAL MOTOR VEHICLES WHEN APPLICABLE IN HIGH RISK CORRIDORS  AND 2  CONDUCT AGGRESSIVE, HIGH VISIBILITY ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES AT THE STATE S FIVE FIXED SCALE LOCATIONS WITH THE GOAL OF IDENTIFYING COMMERCIAL SAFETY VIOLATIONS  THIS ENFORCEMENT WILL BE CONDUCTED AT THESE SPECIFIC LOCATIONS, WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF REDUCING THE STATE S TOTAL NUMBER OF COMMERCIAL MOTOR VEHICLE COLLISIONS, IN ADDITION TO INCREASING THE OVERALL NUMBER OF COMMERCIAL MOTOR VEHICLE STOPS

THIS AWARD TO THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION AIMS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF CONTACTS WITH COMMERCIAL AND PASSENGER VEHICLES OPERATING IN THE VICINITY OF CMVS, WITH A FOCUS ON CITING AND OR REMOVING UNSAFE DRIVERS FROM THE ROADWAYS  PERSONNEL WILL BE ASSIGNED TO FIXED TRUCK INSPECTION SITES AND ROVING ENFORCEMENT ON THE ROADWAYS SURROUNDING THE INSPECTION SITES  DESIGNATED LOCATIONS WILL BE BASED ON LARGE TRUCK CRASH STATISTICS IDENTIFIED IN NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION S ACCIDENT LOCATION INFORMATION SYSTEM  ALIS  AND ADEQUATE SPACE AND LIGHTING TO CONDUCT COMMERCIAL VEHICLE INSPECTIONS SAFELY  CMV INSPECTORS WILL FOCUS ON UNSAFE DRIVING, PHYSICAL STATE OF THE OPERATORS, DRIVER QUALIFICATIONS, HOURS OF SERVICE REGULATIONS, AND VEHICLE VIOLATIONS

THIS AWARD TO THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF STATE POLICE AIMS TO INCREASE THE UNDERSTANDING OF CONTRIBUTING FACTORS OF CMV CRASHES IN VIRGINIA AND TO SUPPORT TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT DECISIONS TO REDUCE CMV CRASHES  VIRGINIA TECH TRANSPORTATION INSTITUTE  VTTI  WILL BE CONTRACTED FOR CMV CRASH CORRIDOR AND CRASH CAUSATION ANALYSIS  THEY WILL CONDUCT A PILOT TEST OF TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT IN ONE OF THE IDENTIFIED CMV CRASH CORRIDORS FOCUSED ON REDUCING THE CONTRIBUTING FACTORS  ULTIMATELY, THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO IDENTIFY AN EFFECTIVE TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT PROGRAM VIA A DATA BASED DECISION PROCESS AND PILOT TEST THE PROGRAM TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF FATAL CMV CRASHES

THE GOAL IS TO INCREASE POLICE PRESENCE IN BOTH WORK ZONES AND HIGHWAY CRASH CORRIDORS TO KEEP MOTORISTS AND CONSTRUCTION WORKERS SAFE DURING THE FY 2022 TO FY 2024 PROJECT YEARS  THE ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE CONCENTRATED ON BOTH CMV AND NON CMV TRAFFIC  ADDITIONALLY, PERSONNEL WILL FOCUS THEIR EFFORTS ON TRAFFIC VIOLATORS DURING OFF PEAK TRAFFIC HOURS  TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT INITIATIVES WILL ALSO TAKE PLACE ON OTHER ROADWAYS THAT HAVE SHOWN HIGH INCIDENCES IN TRAFFIC CRASHES

THIS AWARD TO THE VIRGINIA POLYTECHNIC INSTITUTE AND STATE UNIVERSITY AIMS TO INCREASE DRIVERS   INCLUDING NEWLY LICENSED TEEN DRIVERS AND OLDER ADULTS  KNOWLEDGE OF SAFE DRIVING PRACTICES RELATED TO SHARING THE ROAD WITH CMVS  TO ACCOMPLISH THIS GOAL, VTTI WILL   1  CONDUCT IN CLASS DEMONSTRATIONS IN 80 HIGH SCHOOL DRIVER EDUCATION PROGRAMS BETWEEN THE FALL OF 2022 AND THE SPRING OF 2024   2  CONDUCT MONTHLY OUTREACH FOR THE TIPS FOR SHARING THE ROAD WITH COMMERCIAL MOTOR VEHICLES WEBSITE   3  CONDUCT TWO TRAIN THE TRAINER SEMINARS FOR AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF RETIRED PERSONS  AARP  VOLUNTEER DRIVER EDUCATION INSTRUCTORS   4  WORK WITH AARP COMMUNICATIONS AND ROADWAY SAFETY TEAMS TO DEVELOP A SERIES OF ARTICLES COVERING THE KEY STRATEGIES FOR SHARING THE ROAD WITH TRUCKS

THIS AWARD TO THE VT AGENCY OF TRANSPORTATION AIMS TO INCREASE THE VISIBILITY AND NUMBER OF HOURS VERMONT MOTOR VEHICLE INSPECTORS SPEND ON RURAL ROADS TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF CRASHES, INJURIES, AND FATALITIES INVOLVING LARGE TRUCKS AND BUSES  ROVING PATROLS WILL INCREASE VISIBILITY WHILE DETECTING MOVING VIOLATIONS  FIXED SITE DETAILS WILL INCREASE VISIBILITY AND THE ABILITY TO DETECT NON MOVING DRIVER VIOLATIONS  DRIVER VIOLATIONS DISCOVERED WILL RESULT IN AN INSPECTION  INCREASED ENFORCEMENT WILL CHANGE DRIVER BEHAVIOR RESULTING IN ENHANCED COMPLIANCE

THIS AWARD TO THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES IS TO REDUCE THE TOTAL NUMBER OF CMV CRASHES IN HIGH CRASH AREAS, INCREASE TOTAL NUMBER OF IDENTIFIED DRIVERS FOUND TO BE PROHIBITED IN THE DRUG AND ALCOHOL CLEARINGHOUSE DURING ROADSIDE INSPECTIONS, AND REDUCE THE TOTAL NUMBER OF CMV CRASHES IN THE DESIGNATED WORK ZONES BY CONDUCTING WEEKLY HIGH VISIBILITY TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT IN DESIGNATED HIGH CRASH AREAS ON INTERSTATE HIGHWAYS AND CONNECTING PRINCIPAL AND MINOR ARTERIAL ROADWAYS

THIS AWARD TO THE CHESTERFIELD COUNTY POLICE DEPARTMENT AIMS TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF OVERALL CMV RELATED CRASHES, REDUCE THE NUMBER OF CMV RELATED INJURIES, AND MAINTAIN THE NUMBER OF CMV RELATED FATALITIES OF ZERO  OFFICERS WILL ENGAGE IN OVERTIME ENFORCEMENT ON HIGH CRASH CORRIDORS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY TO GATHER DATA FOR A BASELINE WITHIN THE COUNTY  THIS DATA WILL THEN BE USED TO IDENTIFY OTHER PROBLEM AREAS IN NEED OF THE OVERTIME ENFORCEMENT, WHERE THE UNIT WILL THEN BE DEPLOYED

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD TO THE PUBLIC SERVICE COMMISSION OF WEST VIRGINIA IS TO REDUCE CRASHES, REDUCE FATALITIES AND IMPROVE SAFETY  THE ROADWAYS IDENTIFIED IN THIS PROJECT ARE INTERSTATE HIGHWAYS  THE ACTIVITIES WILL FOCUS ON TARGETING UNSAFE DRIVING BY CMV DRIVERS IN HIGH CRASH CORRIDORS WHILE IMPROVING EFFORTS AT IDENTIFYING CARRIERS IN VIOLATION OF FEDERAL OUT OF SERVICE ORDERS AND IMPROVING COMPLIANCE WITH CMV REGULATIONS AND REGULATIONS ON SPEEDING AS WELL AS SAFETY IN WORK ZONES

THIS AWARD TO THE SOUTH CAROLINA STATE UNIVERSITY IS FOR RESEARCH TO DEVELOP A SAFETY APPLICATION FOR CMVS IN WHICH AN ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE BASED  AI  MODEL IS CREATED  THE APPLICATION WILL DETECT VEHICLES UNDER DIFFERENT WEATHER AND LIGHTING CONDITIONS, AND SUBSEQUENTLY GENERATE SAFETY ALERTS FOR A POTENTIAL RISK OF A CRASH  SUCH APPLICATION NEEDS TO BE DEVELOPED BASED ON A THOROUGH UNDERSTANDING OF A RISK BASED WARNING SYSTEM FOR CMVS AND REAL TIME SYSTEM PERFORMANCE  USING AN AI MODEL, THE SYSTEM CAN GENERATE BASIC SAFETY MESSAGE DATA, AND WILL ESTIMATE THE POTENTIAL TIME OF CONFLICT  IF CMVS ARE IN A COLLISION PATH WITH OTHER VEHICLES, A WARNING WILL BE SHOWN USING A DYNAMIC MESSAGE SIGN  THESE SIGNS WILL BE PLACED AT VARIOUS WORK ZONES  THE ALERTS WILL BE GENERATED IN REAL TIME, SATISFYING THE REQUIREMENTS OF SAFETY CRITICAL CMV RELATED APPLICATIONS, AND EVENTUALLY IMPROVING THE SAFETY OF CMVS AND NON CMVS

THIS AWARD TO THE STATE OF OHIO AIMS TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF CMV CRASHES ON IDENTIFIED HIGH RISK RURAL ROADS DURING THE GRANT PERIOD  THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOCATE 6,000 OVERTIME HOURS FOR CONDUCTING TARGETED INSPECTIONS ON CMVS  THIS WILL BE DETERMINED BY OHIO S ELECTRONIC CRASH SYSTEM CMV CRASH DATA STATEWIDE AND FOR THE IDENTIFIED HIGH RISK RURAL ROADS DURING THE GRANT PERIOD

THIS AWARD TO THE PUBLIC UTILITIES COMMISSION OF OHIO IS TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF CMV CRASHES ON IDENTIFIED HIGH CRASH CORRIDORS DURING THE GRANT PERIOD  THIS WILL BE DETERMINED BY THE USE OF OHIO S ELECTRONIC CRASH SYSTEM CMV CRASH DATA FOR IDENTIFYING HIGH CRASH CORRIDORS DURING THE GRANT PERIOD  ALL OHIO STATE HIGHWAY PATROL TROOPERS, SERGEANTS, LIEUTENANTS, AND STAFF LIEUTENANTS WILL BE ELIGIBLE TO WORK ON THIS PROJECT

THIS AWARD TO THE KANSAS HIGHWAY PATROL IS TO SUPPORT THE REDUCTION OF INJURY AND FATALITY COLLISIONS BY INCREASING NON CMV ENFORCEMENT IN AREAS ACROSS THE STATE WITH HIGHER COLLISION RATES  ENFORCEMENT WILL SPECIFICALLY TARGET SEATBELT AND ACCIDENT CAUSING VIOLATIONS OCCURRING DURING CMV OPERATIONS  IN ORDER TO TARGET THESE VIOLATIONS, THE KANSAS HIGHWAY PATROL WILL UTILIZE A DIVERSE WORKFORCE OF TROOPERS IN BOTH TRADITIONAL AND NON TRADITIONAL PATROL VEHICLES  KANSAS DOES NOT HAVE AN ISOLATED CMV CRASH CORRIDOR  RATHER A MAJORITY OF THE ACCIDENTS INVOLVING CMVS ARE CONCENTRATED IN THREE METRO AREAS  KANSAS WILL FOCUS THE DISTRIBUTION OF RESOURCES SPECIFICALLY IN THESE VULNERABLE AREAS TO ELIMINATE DISPARITIES AND IMPROVE SAFETY FOR EVERYONE

THIS AWARD TO THE SUFFOLK COUNTY SHERIFF S OFFICE IS TO DECREASE CMV CRASHES IN HIGH CRASH CORRIDORS, REDUCE CMV LARGE TRUCK CRASHES, INCREASE CMV TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT INSPECTIONS, AND INCREASE CMV TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT VIOLATIONS  SUFFOLK COUNTY SHERIFF OFFICE WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH NYS DOT AND OTHER LOCAL POLICE AGENCIES TO IMPROVE CMV TRAFFIC SAFETY AND ANALYZE CRASH DATA  AREAS OF FOCUS WILL INCLUDE MAIN ACCESS ROUTES, WORK ZONES, AND RURAL ROADS IN TARGETED ZONES  EFFORTS WILL BE MADE TO ELIMINATE DISTRACTED DRIVING BY CMV OPERATORS, PREVENT SECONDARY CRASHES AT INVESTIGATION SCENES, AND IMPROVE OVERALL SAFETY  CMV CARRIERS THAT ARE IN VIOLATION WILL BE INSPECTED AND EDUCATED

THIS AWARD TO THE WYOMING DOT HIGHWAY PATROL AIMS TO ENHANCE THE STATE INTERNATIONAL REGISTRATION PLAN  IRP  SYSTEM TO PROVIDE MORE COMPLETE AND ACCURATE VEHICLE REGISTRATION DATA TO THE IRP DATA REPOSITORY AND PROVIDE AT LEAST DAILY UPDATES OF THE VEHICLE DATA TO THE IRP DATA REPOSITORY  MEETING THESE OBJECTIVES WOULD PROMOTE SAFETY BY PROVIDING DATA TO SCREENING SYSTEMS WHICH WOULD ALLOW ENFORCEMENT TO TARGET UNSAFE VEHICLES  IT WOULD ALSO PROVIDE BETTER DATA TO AND THROUGH THE PRISM PROGRAM

THIS AWARD TO THE NORTH CAROLINA DEPT OF PUBLIC SAFETY IS TO REDUCE CMV CRASHES AND FATALITIES BY CONDUCTING SUSTAINED, DATA DRIVEN, HIGH VISIBILITY TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT OPERATIONS THAT TARGET UNSAFE DRIVING OF CMVS AND NON CMVS IN AREAS IDENTIFIED AS INTERSTATE HIGH CRASH CORRIDORS  EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON CMV TRAFFIC VIOLATIONS IN THE PROXIMITY OF THE ASSIGNED INTERSTATE SEGMENTS SUCH AS  SPEEDING, FOLLOWING TOO CLOSELY, DRIVING WHILE IMPAIRED, DISTRACTED DRIVING, AND OPERATING AGGRESSIVELY AND CARELESSLY

THIS AWARD TO THE KENTUCKY STATE POLICE  KSP  IS TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF CMV INJURY CRASHES ON IDENTIFIED INTERSTATE CORRIDORS  THE GOAL IS TO REDUCE CRASH THREATENING BEHAVIOR AND INCREASE THE PERCEPTION OF ENFORCEMENT  THE KSP WILL UTILIZE OVERTIME ENFORCEMENT ON CMVS ACCOMPANIED WITH AN INSPECTION  TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT WILL ALSO BE CONDUCTED ON NON CMVS FOR TRAFFIC VIOLATIONS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD TO THE STATE OF ALASKA, DOT IS TO  1  CONDUCT DEPLOYMENTS FOR COMMERCIAL MOTOR VEHICLE  CMV  SAFETY INSPECTIONS AND DRIVER CONTACTS IN RURAL AREAS TO MAINTAIN ROAD SAFETY AND ENSURE SAFETY COMPLIANCE FOR VEHICLES THAT DO NOT REGULARLY PASS A FIXED WEIGH STATION  THIS WILL BE DONE BY CONDUCTING STRATEGICALLY LOCATED DEPLOYMENTS AND TARGETING PREVIOUSLY UNSEEN CMVS AND THEIR DRIVERS  2  PROVIDE LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES INFORMATION RELATED TO CMV COMPLIANCE AND HUMAN TRAFFICKING PREVENTION  THIS WILL BE DONE BY CONDUCTING OUTREACHES TO THOSE AGENCIES IN AREAS WITH LITTLE DAY TO DAY PRESENCE OF CMVS  PROVIDING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO THOSE AGENCIES WILL FURTHER BUILD PARTNERSHIPS AND COMMUNICATIONS LINKS BETWEEN STATE AND LOCAL AGENCIES
